Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2011 10:52AM shirleyanne wrote: I knit my foobs a la British women-soft yarn and filled with polyfiber for washing machine.  Soft against scars if you use baby yarn.  Can fill a lot or not so much.  Used small velcro pieces in old Vanity Fair underwires, 40 D, to keep foobs from riding up.  Comfortable for all day.  I'm two years past surgery for dmx.  Pattern for knitting foobs can be found on internet search-'knit prosthesis' and is free.  Doesn't take more than an afternoon or an evening to produce the whole thing while watching t.v.  The tee shirt pockets would undoubtedly work well also.  I'm still 'fussing' with the amount of filling to put in, and have done several variations-six pairs of foobs.  Total cost, under $10.00.  If you don't knit, perhaps you have a friend or mother who does-or it's a good time to learn! Good luck to all.
Posts.Title: aaahhhhh bra or genie bra TAPPY DocBabs
